tool.name: odgi viz
tool.command: odgi viz -i '$input' --out='$output' -x $width -y $height #if str($path_height) --path-height=$path_height #end if #if str($path_x_padding) --path-x-padding=$path_x_padding #end if #if $pack_paths $pack_paths #end if #if str($link_path_pieces) --link-path-pieces=$link_path_pieces #end if @THREADS@

param.label: Width in pixels of output image
Height in pixels of output image
Pack all paths rather than displaying a single path per row
Show thin links of this relative width to connect path pieces

tool.help:
@HELP_HEADER@
`odgi viz` renders linear visualizations of ODGI graphs as raster images.
### Inputs
- **odgi input file**: Graph to visualize. - **Width / Height**: Target PNG dimensions. - **Path display height / Path x padding**: Control per-path track sizing. - **Pack all paths**: Toggle packed layout versus one path per row. - **Show thin links**: Draw connecting lines between fragmented path pieces.
### Outputs
- **PNG**: Rendered visualization.
